html: Did not knowingly ≠ was not culpable. purposely = conscious object to act knowingly = practically certain that conduct will lead to result recklessly = conscious disregard of substantial & unjustified risk negligently = should have been aware of the risk All = culpablehttps://twitter.com/donnabrazile/status/1118882433615708161 …
text:
Did not knowingly ≠ was not culpable.

purposely = conscious object to act
knowingly = practically certain that conduct will lead to result
recklessly = conscious disregard of substantial & unjustified risk
negligently = should have been aware of the risk

All = culpablehttps://twitter.com/donnabrazile/status/1118882433615708161 …

html: Words to pay attention to in Attorney General Barr's statement of his thoughts on the Mueller Report. "Did not knowingly" does not mean "was not culpable." From @LIICornell's summary of the Model Penal Code. #MuellerThursdaypic.twitter.com/vJZz1ZwXvg
text:
Words to pay attention to in Attorney General Barr's statement of his thoughts on the Mueller Report. "Did not knowingly" does not mean "was not culpable." From @LIICornell's summary of the Model Penal Code.

html: I say this to the President, and his defenders in Congress: You may think it’s okay how Trump and his associates interacted with Russians during the campaign. I don’t. I think it’s immoral. text:
I say this to the President, and his defenders in Congress:

You may think it’s okay how Trump and his associates interacted with Russians during the campaign.

I don’t.

I think it’s immoral. I think it’s unethical. I think it’s unpatriotic. And yes, I think it’s corrupt.pic.twitter.com/nTdgRVfssQ

html: Sgt. Ron Helus was one of the first people to arrive on the scene. He was shot while saving lives in the line of duty and died at the hospital. A 29-year police veteran and father, Sgt. Helus was planning to retire next year. My heart goes out to his loved ones. He’s a hero.
text: Sgt. Ron Helus was one of the first people to arrive on the scene. He was shot while saving lives in the line of duty and died at the hospital. A 29-year police veteran and father, Sgt. Helus was planning to retire next year. My heart goes out to his loved ones. He’s a hero.

html: Yesterday, I voted against the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act, which would require New Jersey to accept concealed carry permits from states that set low standards. The bill is the peak of federal overreach and would undermine public safety in NJ.pic.twitter.com/Fba0SFlcIY
